cluster_relations.rel_desc: The Hook Man legend exhibits new forms and variations of legends.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an entity (such as a specific legend) displays or embodies a particular characteristic, feature, or pattern.
cluster_relations.object_entity_name: new forms and variations of legends
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Narrative Truth, Sources, and Explanatory Roles
remarks: Maps the general idea of variations onto this concrete legend instance.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The bloody hook is found hanging from the car door handle.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a physical object is fastened, hanging from, or otherwise physically connected to another object.

qualifiers.ConditionExpression: only to discover a bloody hook

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The spread of urban legends is greatly facilitated by advancements in technology and communication.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject state or process is causally enabled or facilitated by the existence or operation of the object.

qualifiers.OperationalConstraint: when modern technology and communication tools are available
qualifiers.UncertaintyQualifier: has been greatly facilitated (qualitative, not quantified)

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a specific narrative or legend serves as an example of, or concretely manifests, a broader narrative pattern, form, or type.
args.justification: The relation describes the Hook Man legend as an instance that manifests new forms and variations of legends, which is closer to exemplifying a broader narrative pattern than merely exhibiting a generic characteristic. Updating the canonical name to 'exemplifies_narrative_pattern' and the class to 'narrative_pattern_relation' better captures that it links an instance to an abstract pattern/type, while still fitting under the broad ATTRIBUTE group.
